question.query: what projects are trending on base and solana

steps.text:
[
  {
    "type": "text",
    "text": "![7-Day Net Flows for Major Blockchain Ecosystems](https://res.cloudinary.com/dgjriemfd/image/upload/v1767916097/veldt/lsyyxewdqkr5ovenvmmg.jpg)

## Trending on **Base**
Base “trending” right now is less about random new tokens and more about **BTC rails + DeFi liquidity concentration + privacy payments**.

- **Aerodrome Finance (AERO)**: still the gravity well for Base liquidity and incentives. Also the place where metrics get distorted—there’s credible onchain analysis showing **LP-churning/wash volume on bridged SOL pairs**, so treat “Base volume” screenshots with a BS-meter.
- **Morpho (MORPHO)**: Base lending activity is hot; Morpho on Base is showing **>$1B active loans** (Token Terminal charted it), largely pushed by **USDC + cbBTC collateral loops** and Base-native leverage.
- **Hinkal**: **confidential payments live on Base** (shielded↔public, payment links). This is an actual new primitive that can pull builders even if token price action lags.
- **Bedrock / uniBTC + cbBTC LP**: six-week incentive campaign with **60,000 OP** on the uniBTC/cbBTC Uniswap pool. This type of program temporarily dominates “what’s trending” because it drives mercenary liquidity and volume spikes.
- **Resolv**: yield split changed (**Base Rate 70%→85%**) which reprices where stablecoin yield chases on Base.

## Trending on **Solana**
Solana trend is **execution venues + launch mechanics + new payment/reputation rails**, with memecoin churn still the volume driver.

- **Trojan on Solana**: launched Arena + a **$5M SOL rewards** program. That’s a direct catalyst for user/trader growth because it subsidizes activity.
- **Jupiter (JUP)**: still the center of gravity for routing + lending; recent governance changes (BAM incentives / validator revenue routing) keep it in the headline flow.
- **Raydium (RAY)**: disclosed **569k RAY buybacks** since start of Q1—market tends to front-run “protocol bid” narratives even when buybacks aren’t structurally bullish.
- **Pump.fun**: overhauled creator-fee mechanics (splits, post-launch assignment, ownership transfer). Any change to launchpad mechanics tends to show up as “trend” because it alters memecoin throughput.
- **Ranger Finance (RNGR)**: public ICO demand was huge (**$86.4M committed**, capped at $8M) and token went live right after—classic Solana attention magnet.
- **NYC Token**: trending for the wrong reason—onchain activity flagged ~**$3.4M liquidity drain** hours after launch.

### What actually “popped” in the last few hours (Solana screens)
- **67**: **~+268%** price (4h), **+168% volume**, **+75.7% traders**, **~$1.84M liquidity**  
- **9bit**: trader count up (**+89.7%**) but with oversold technicals; more like a bounce setup than sustained trend

",
    "providerMetadata": {
      "openai": {
        "itemId": "msg_0d4f640a528cf1bc006966b32888808194b4717ed6bc0e4645"
      }
    }
  }
]

![7-Day Net Flows for Major Blockchain Ecosystems](https://res.cloudinary.com/dgjriemfd/image/upload/v1767916097/veldt/lsyyxewdqkr5ovenvmmg.jpg)

## Trending on **Base**
Base “trending” right now is less about random new tokens and more about **BTC rails + DeFi liquidity concentration + privacy payments**.

- **Aerodrome Finance (AERO)**: still the gravity well for Base liquidity and incentives. Also the place where metrics get distorted—there’s credible onchain analysis showing **LP-churning/wash volume on bridged SOL pairs**, so treat “Base volume” screenshots with a BS-meter.
- **Morpho (MORPHO)**: Base lending activity is hot; Morpho on Base is showing **>$1B active loans** (Token Terminal charted it), largely pushed by **USDC + cbBTC collateral loops** and Base-native leverage.
- **Hinkal**: **confidential payments live on Base** (shielded↔public, payment links). This is an actual new primitive that can pull builders even if token price action lags.
- **Bedrock / uniBTC + cbBTC LP**: six-week incentive campaign with **60,000 OP** on the uniBTC/cbBTC Uniswap pool. This type of program temporarily dominates “what’s trending” because it drives mercenary liquidity and volume spikes.
- **Resolv**: yield split changed (**Base Rate 70%→85%**) which reprices where stablecoin yield chases on Base.

## Trending on **Solana**
Solana trend is **execution venues + launch mechanics + new payment/reputation rails**, with memecoin churn still the volume driver.

- **Trojan on Solana**: launched Arena + a **$5M SOL rewards** program. That’s a direct catalyst for user/trader growth because it subsidizes activity.
- **Jupiter (JUP)**: still the center of gravity for routing + lending; recent governance changes (BAM incentives / validator revenue routing) keep it in the headline flow.
- **Raydium (RAY)**: disclosed **569k RAY buybacks** since start of Q1—market tends to front-run “protocol bid” narratives even when buybacks aren’t structurally bullish.
- **Pump.fun**: overhauled creator-fee mechanics (splits, post-launch assignment, ownership transfer). Any change to launchpad mechanics tends to show up as “trend” because it alters memecoin throughput.
- **Ranger Finance (RNGR)**: public ICO demand was huge (**$86.4M committed**, capped at $8M) and token went live right after—classic Solana attention magnet.
- **NYC Token**: trending for the wrong reason—onchain activity flagged ~**$3.4M liquidity drain** hours after launch.

### What actually “popped” in the last few hours (Solana screens)
- **67**: **~+268%** price (4h), **+168% volume**, **+75.7% traders**, **~$1.84M liquidity**  
- **9bit**: trader count up (**+89.7%**) but with oversold technicals; more like a bounce setup than sustained trend

parameters.instructions: Find trending Base ecosystem tokens with strong recent trader growth and high volume change; prefer liquid tokens (>$250k liquidity) across any category; exclude stablecoins and wrapped majors.
Find trending Solana tokens with strong recent trader growth and high volume change; prefer liquid tokens (>$500k liquidity) across any category; exclude stablecoins and wrapped majors.
